text: the Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin
Netanyahu has said he believes all
countries will follow the US and
recognizing Jerusalem as the capital of
his country but the foreign policy chief
of the European Union appearing with him
in Brussels said the EU wouldn't be
changing its policy let's hear what both
have been starting saying starting with
Prime Minister Netanyahu and it's time
that the Palestinians recognize the
Jewish state and also recognize the fact
that it has a capital it's called
Jerusalem I believe that even though we
don't have an agreement yet this is what
will happen in the future I believe that
all or most of the European countries
will move their embassies to Jerusalem
recognized Jerusalem as Israel's capital
and engage robustly with us for security
prosperity and peace you know where the
European Union stands we believe that
the only realistic solution to the
conflict between Israel and Palestine is
based on two states with Jerusalem as
the capital of both the State of Israel
and the state of Palestine along the 67
line this is our consolidated position
and we will continue to respect the
international consensus on Jerusalem
until the final status of the old city
is resolved to direct negotiations
between the parties and we hope that the
parties can engage in meaningful direct
negotiations with the support of the
international community well let's talk
about this now with our your
correspondent Gavin Lee who's in
Brussels so Gavin
federica mogherini delivering a clear
message there to Benjamin Netanyahu
Vasavi the position of Jerusalem away
from those officials statements what
have you been hearing about how he

that's a an Israeli leader has been

have their shared capital of Jerusalem
going back at

that position hasn't changed so you have

saying this far as he sees it
what happened by with Donald Trump was

there is to be recognition wider that
there is a capital and I sense it's the
feelers going out now to see who else
might join him by saying that you know
in future other European countries might
go the same way
federica mogherini said she's speaking
on behalf of European countries and
European leaders to say that this is not
the way forward and she strictly is
concerned about that on a very serious
level I think just a reminder and note
this as well a few days ago Benjamin

about moving their embassies to

has changed by what we've seen today
that hasn't I wonder what since you have
of the the diplomacy diplomacy that's

negotiations have to be handled very
delicately because no one wants no one

and we've seen some small skirmishes
haven't we in not just in around us of

coming to to Brussels in a few weeks
time as well so I think it's trying to
balance this trying to kick-start the

this I think almost galvanized the
Israeli prime minister to hear these
words of Donald Trump's and to work out
is there anything in this apparently

crisis as well you can't
but wonder if the Israeli Prime
